website_summaries.verdict: Though it's slightly more expensive than competing inkjet workhorses, we recommend the Epson WorkForce 845 for its refined design and Epson's Connect cloud-printing portfolio.
pros: The Epson WorkForce 845 excels in print speeds and output quality, with hardware working overtime in autoduplexing, wireless networking, and mobile printing support by way of Epson's suite of Connect mobile printing services
cons: Photo print speeds are slightly lower than for the average inkjet, and the packaging doesn't include the USB and Ethernet cables required for a tethered connection

customer_reviews.title: Will NEVER buy an Epson printer again!
customer_reviews.text: 1 star is too many, should be ZERO. I've had it with cartridges not being recognized errors! Seriously, I have never once been able to change a cartridge in this thing without fighting with it for hours. Today was the last straw, I changed the black ink and all of the sudden it can't recognize the Yellow cartridge, which is full. After 30 minutes of trying different things I'm done. Just ordered a different printer (NOT Epson) and I'm now going to take this hunk of garbage out to the garage and take a sledge hammer to it. I will NEVER buy Epson again and I strongly advise all reading this to save themselves and don't buy Epson.
customer_reviews.author: GCG

customer_reviews.title: Bought this from Amazon in 2012 and nearly no issues!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so working from home I am thinking maybe I will upgrade this Epson Printer. I bought it from Amazon in 2012 and it is going strong. I fax, scan and print. I found 3rd party cartridges and they work fine. Soooooo from reading the reviews of the other printers I might stand pat. People are having issues after three months on other newer printers and this lasted me 8 years!!!! Really got my money's worth on this printer!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Petey

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you do not print often.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, this printer needs to be used often. If you do not use often, the printer heads gets clogged with dried ink. Running cleaning function and even manually cleaning heads will not improve print quality. You will have banding, rendering the printer useless. Only reason it gets two stars document feeder and scanning worked well. Printer bought in 2012 for $250, now worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Junky junk junk
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave reviews but I was compelled this time. This Epson printer is the biggest piece of junk i can imagine. The quality of the print is poor and the colors are also misaligned. The answer Epson always gives you is to, SURPRISE, "replace ink cartridges" Okay, so I've done that twice now, the second time buying directly from Epson just to be sure I wasn't getting some grey market ink cartridges. And, same problems. Colors are off, edges are not crisp. Save your money people, this thing is total junk!
customer_reviews.author: Nybuyer999

customer_reviews.title: I was so hoping that this printer would be better than the 2 year old HP I junked
customer_reviews.text: I was so hoping that this printer would be better than the 2 year old HP I junked. While it hasn't had things break on it causing me to do work arounds, it really sucks the ink, and that makes it expensive to operate. For a while I tired aftermarket inks and I stopped doing that for fear that the machine would quit working. Judging from my pile of spent ink cartridges, the ink usage for this printer is extraordinarily high.
customer_reviews.author: marypr

customer_reviews.title: Probably obsolete
customer_reviews.text: This office quality printer model line was indicated as obsolete. The replacement Epson model line did not get good reviews on any of the web accessed review sites. Found 2 factory rebuilt ones at Epson, and then 2 new ones at Amazon. Decided to pony up the price difference for new and have not been sorry.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Has been a great workhorse for us
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good printer. It offers some good functionality including good quality scanning in both B/W and in color. There is always an issue with the cost of ink cartridge replacements but if you are smart in using the devices features to print only those pages you need in the lowest quality you need, you can stretch an ink cartridge for quite a while. I would buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Banchak

customer_reviews.title: Epson Ought to be Ashamed of this Product.
customer_reviews.text: This Amazon purchase was a rare mistake. The printer kept indicating that non-Epson cartridges were installed when in fact genuine Epson cartridges were installed.Then it would falsely claim that no cartridges were installed. The next scourge was smeared black ink on documents. Epson customer service provided little value. This machine was a piece of junk. It's back to HP for me.
customer_reviews.author: RobertoR

customer_reviews.title: The best I've had so far, although it's an older model today
customer_reviews.text: I have never had problems with this printer, unlike any others I have had. It works great with wi-fi, quality printing, it's fast, the touch is responsive, the cartridge lasts a long time and the menu is intuitive, so you don't have to go to the manual all the time. Despite being old, it has practically everything that the most modern offer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Madeira

customer_reviews.title: Updated, more positive review after cleaning & alignments
customer_reviews.text: Update: I purchased a refurbished model and put up with lines in the color printing for a good length of time. I want to edit my review due to the fact that it prints well since I cleaned the ink jets, installed new ink cartridges, and did several alignments. It now prints as expected. I have not tried to print a photo. I have not printed any photos since I started using this printer; however, now that my printing issue has been resolved, I will probably give it a try in the future. The main negative is that it has made me wary of buying refurbished. I still have an issue with my refurbished Olympus camera; but, that's another story.
customer_reviews.author: sonya

customer_reviews.title: Love my Workforce 845
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for 8 years and still LOVE it!! Update drivers regularly (easy peasy!) and it runs like a champion! Unlike other printers I've owned over the years, it isn't an ink guzzler, either. If my current model ever decides to give up the ghost, I'll be replacing with another Epson 3-in-1.
customer_reviews.author: Aavid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Designed to force you to buy ink you don't need. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am sitting here, next to my printer as I write this. I need to print an important document before 7pm today. The document is entirely black and white and I have a full black ink cartridge. But the printer is out of blue ink. Epson designed this thing so that it turns off ALL printing functionality as soon as ANY color cartridge runs dry. So even though I have enough black ink to print a thousand documents, I can't print anything at all! That's ridiculous. I get to make a frantic trip around town this evening to try and find a blue color cartridge and if I don't find one, I'll miss my deadline. Thanks a lot, Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Ink Eater Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: This printer works well when it does work! But it seems to have many errors and eats ink! If you don't have ALL the cartridges for it it WILL NOT WORK, THIS IS REALLY ANNOYING! Example you cannot print just black and white with a black toner cartridge you must have all color as well! Other than that it works well and is easy to setup and use. Still not worth it though I would suggest buying another printer.
customer_reviews.author: MasterYi

customer_reviews.title: A great Sprinter, not a Marathon Runner!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked Great for 1 year, right after the 1yr mfg warranty expired and it went out of commission on me. In all fairness, it was heavily used as we are currently homeschooling 4 school-age kids. That being said, this is not the first printer we have ever used in this capacity. It's however the shortest lived printer. The Epson Rep was polite and courteous but his assistance to me was limited to profuse apologies. I was hoping to jump on the Epson band wagon, but it appears it was not meant to be. Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Willis Twum

customer_reviews.title: Good all-in-one at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific wireless printer for the price. If you need professional-quality printing output, this may fall short in quality. If you are happy with basic scanning, copying, and printing at a super affordable price, this is the all-in-one for you. Very easy to hook up to your home wireless network. You can find really inexpensive after-market ink cartridges on Amazon. No need to buy the pricey ones from Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Hall

customer_reviews.title: "Cannot recognize the cartridges"
customer_reviews.text: Spent an hour unpacking and installing this printer. I installed the ink cartridges that came with the printer, and they are marked as genuine Epson cartridges. Yet, every time I go to print, I get an error message that says the printer cannot recognize any of the ink cartridges. And it won't let me do anything after that except reinsert each and every cartridge. Then I have to wait for the ink cartridges to be warmed up, then it will allow me to print exactly one print job before resorting back to the "cannot recognize the ink cartridges" error message. Complete waste of my time and money. I will pack it all up and return to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: L. Recker

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This printer goes through ink cartridges quickly, even the high yield kind. After nine months, there was a paper jam during two-sided printing, the jammed paper was removed, completely intact, yet the printer still thinks there is a jam. The printer was turned off, unplugged, carefully inspected, and no paper jam exists. An internet search of the issue found an answer from Epson stating a sensor has gone bad. As a Cloud printer, and wireless printer, network printer, it was great. But the expense for the ink, and the fact it has developed this problem after only 9 months, makes it not worth the price. We use it in our small office. It does not get heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Jane

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is barely a printer at all, much less WIRELESS or a scanner. Have NEVER been able to get the wireless capabilities to work, and yes I did follow the instructions. Used to scan, but not anymore. Constantly need to run the head cleaner/aligner so it prints properly. Only consolation is that I only paid 250 for it 6 years ago. Once the ink supply runs out I'll NEVER buy another Epson ever again. PIECE OF JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Great prints
customer_reviews.text: I loved it up until this fall. It makes excellent color-fast prints and copies on a variety of types and sizes of paper and does two-sided without jamming. It worked flawlessly for many months until one day it didn't. This fall it started losing communications with the computer, though both were still communicating with the wi-fi router. I don't know if the problem is in the computer, the router or the printer, but it is annoying. We have to turn off power to all three devices and turn them on again to get it to work after losing communication. Turning off just one or two doesn't solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gravelle Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Epson all-in-one as a replacement for an HP all-in-one that I had for about 7 years. This model is VERY NICE for the price. In fact, I purchased this for about the same price as the cost of a single replacement toner cartridge for the old HP. The Epson is also color where the the old HP was only black and white. The black and white output is very professional and the color is near photo quality and very good considering the price! I'd buy this Epson again in a second and recommend it to anyone needing a good all-in-one (printer cartridges and all) for about $100! Very economical buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kent R. Dills

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer Ever! PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a couple years now! It has stacked up greatly and the build quality is amazing. I've gone through many printers in my day and this truly is a piece of durability. I've printed so much that it keeps on going and going. Just replace the ink cartridge and bam your good to go. It has gone through most of my high school and college printing some of my greatest works and I'm still happy it is still accompanying me for the journey ahead!
customer_reviews.author: Shounoi

customer_reviews.title: One-way ticket to a nervous breakdown
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this printer for two years. Those two years have been a constant cycle of 1) align print head, 2) align nozzlehead, 3) clean nozzlehead, 4) clean print head, and 5) endless test patterns to attempt to improve the print quality. BOTTOM LINE: Only buy this printer if you want to waste countless hours reading web threads on how to get the ink cartridges to work, and if you have bottomless reserves of cash for purchasing pricey replacement ink cartridges (which still won't work!). I've learned my lesson. I'll never buy an Epson product again.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Londres

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, home networking a breeze, and printing from smart phone
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer. I have owned Canon (big fan), HP and others and bought this after researching. I have always wondered why I cant put a ream of paper in the printer. Tired of always filling the printer tray. This has a great capacity for paper in two trays. Printing is sharp. Bought the first one and hooked up to daughters MAC, no problem. Networked it to all 3 of the home computers no problem. Bought a second one for my home office, hooked up to Windows 7 with no problems. Can print using cloud print from my Droid phone as well. Quiet, and although, it is high, takes up less footprint on my desk than previous printers.
customer_reviews.author: Ben from Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Odd design
customer_reviews.text: After several HP products I switched to Epson and learned that where HP has great hardware and iffy driver software, for Epson it's the other way around. The Epson driver works flawlessly but the hardware is a bit clunky. The printer automatically wants to draw paper from the top paper drawer, but the bottom drawer is the one configured for bulk letter-size paper, whereas the top drawer is the one that adjusts to accommodate envelopes and other one-off stock. Early in its life, a piece fell out. I sent a photo to Epson and they couldn't (or wouldn't) identify it. It hasn't affected function, but who knows?
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Roth

customer_reviews.title: failed to preform
customer_reviews.text: The 1st printer lasted less than 2 months before the brain locked up and no printing was possible it was returned to Epson, they sent a refurbished printer that had a broken feed tray and the screen was pulled so far open that is was off the track and had to be forced back into position. The replacement printer last 3 months going steadily down hill. It would print 9 pages of a 20 page document than 8 ,7,6,5,4,3,2 each day or week before an error stopped the printing. Now it will only print 1 page at a time before you need to clear the error and start over. Make printing a mufti-page document so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good printer so far...but it does not copy legal size pages
customer_reviews.text: This printer was purchased for use in a small business. Set up was easy on both Windows 7 & Mac OS X devices. Print quality is satisfactory. I have not tried printing photos as yet. I am very disappointed that this model does not copy legal size pages fully. The scanner glass can only hold letter/A4 pages. The document feeder can hold legal pages, but the copy will be cropped. To copy a full legal page, it has to be reduced to letter size through the printer menu. So it is not possible to copy a legal page and have a full legal sized page printed by this printer. Very disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Island Girl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely NOT a wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: The wireless just does NOT work. EVER. No matter what! Furthermore, this is one EXPENSIVE printer to operate. Ink prices are absurd. Ultimately, this is thing is a piece of junk, I recommend looking for other printers, unless you enjoy wasting money and extreme levels of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: zitcat

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good.....
customer_reviews.text: This Epson is a far improvement from the Dell All-in-one I previously junked, the only knock is that it is a little noisy, but that doesn't bother me.....the print and colors are very good, and the two trays hold a ream (500) of paper, it does print quickly....I have this printer 5 weeks, and it will take more time to conclude a final rating.....but, so far, so good............UPDATE: 5/13/2017....Own this Epson printer almost 5 years and use it daily......just a super excellent product !!!.....I have owned varied printers over 20 years and this one out does them all....Canon, Dell, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Leo F.

customer_reviews.title: A nice machine, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine works well mechanically. It is responsive over a wireless network. But the colors are not accurate. Reading the less-than-helpful information on the Epson website, I am told to adjust my monitor to give accurate colors, which is nonsense. For comparison, I have an Epson Picturemate photo printer that gives accurate colors. So, I just use this big printer that cost nearly $200 for color printing where accuracy is not an issue. I called their telephone number once and was greeted by a helpful woman. Before we could get to the issue, I was cut off and never tried again. Perhaps I should.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for older HP bluetooth all in one...
customer_reviews.text: Trying to unclutter our dual computer work area, my wife and I each had our own printer/scanner. Mine was a much older HP, her's a newer one from a few years ago. I couldn't use mine for a flatbed scanner, and her's wouldn't connect to mine for the scanning option! Frustrating to have to use her's for that. Then this printer/scanner/copier/faxer came in, and the other two left in a hurry! Love this printer, with it's easy setup for sharing anywhere in the house, to the incredible speed, and great quality of prints. The scanner is very fast and once you read a bit, very customizable. Would recommend this one highly.
customer_reviews.author: H. Thomas H.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my parents but they had already bought one so kept it for myself. Great little inexpensive printer, scanner, copier. Scans to jpeg or pdf which is a nice feature. I had forgot it duplexes and was a nice surprise. Wireless is always available and I seem to get decent distance. I have the NX620 at another home and the wireless on that is horrible. I'd buy it again and at the time was only $149 including shipping so couldn't go wrong. Dropped one star for the user interface, non-techies might get a bit confused when it comes to scanning, although I never read the manuals either, which most people don't.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the home office
customer_reviews.text: We picked up this printer for the ability to scan multiple pages all together to replace our old HP flatbed all -in-one. It's fast, sleek, and easy to use. The print from mobile feature could have been much better; i.e. use an app instead of sending the item to some ridiculous epson email address registered to your printer. USB and WiFi connection was seemless. Haven't done any high quality printing yet and I did balk at the price of ink...but I also haven't run out so if it lasts sufficiently I won't complain. So far, for standard business and home printing with moderate amounts of color, this puppy excels.
customer_reviews.author: BeezyHeezy

customer_reviews.title: love this printer! rated high on cnet.com
customer_reviews.text: I trust cnet ratings and this printer is rated very high. It prints fast and accurate. I have it hooked up to my wifi and really enjoy the luxury of wireless printing. The scanning and copying is also high quality. The cost of ink is also very economical, it comes with two cartridges of black and 3 individual cartridges of the cyan, magenta, and yellow. I hardly have to replace the latter 3, however the black seems to go first. Overall, I highly recommend this printer. I have owned this printer since 2013, and it is still working great!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product as a replacement for a two-year-old Kodak unit that decided it no longer wanted to cooperate. The price of this Epson was right, the features are great, and the set up was relatively quick and easy. We're used to wireless and this unit works like a charm. We used the included disk to load the drivers to our laptop computers and were able to download the drivers from the web for our daughter's netbook. Print quality is excellent (love the auto duplex). If you're interested in a quality, low cost printer for everyday home print jobs you cannot go wrong with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good usability
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this printer is just clever. It's got great industrial design getting all the little things right. The on-device screen can angle up in case the printer is lower than eye level. The drivers can update themselves for you. It actually ASKS if you want to install the Epson monitor icon in your system tray, it doesn't do it without your consent, requiring you to remove the thing later. The software overall is great, both on the device and the drivers. I don't think the on-device UI could be much better given how small it is. And of course, it makes some very nice prints for the money, too.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer because it could be used wireless with my Iphone. The set up was so easy (done in just a few minutes) I set up my husband's phone, too. He uses this for business when he's home. He was so impressed, but I didn't lead on how easy it was! It prints great quality, faxes easy and is really quick to print! I loved this so much I treated my grown son to one! I have the WorkForce 430 in another home. This is superior to that printer. Spend the money and get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Dorene Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Double sided printing broke after a year. Difficulty with ...
customer_reviews.text: Double sided printing broke after a year. Difficulty with connecting other devices to the printer. If cartridges are not used in about 15 days they dry out and you have to go through the head cleaning process. Very frustrating. Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: FrankGre

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an all-in-one printer, etc. to replace individual copier, printer and scanner. I read the reviews and - along with the good price - went for the Epson 845. I have been very pleased. I do not use the FAX function - but, the print, copy and scan functions work very well. I liked this one - purchased for our second home - so much that I got the same model for home. Set-up is straight forward and print, scan and copy are good quality . . . as in very clear. I have not used the wireless set-up on either unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForce 845
customer_reviews.text: Works great, so far my only complaint is where the printed papers come out the pullout holder that holds them is a bit short so sometimes they fall down to the floor. LoL :) Oh well, its not perfect but it prints nice and FAST. The printer has never been hooked up direct. After i got the printer, all I did was plug in all ink and turn on printer and it asked if i wanted to find network connection. It was so easy to get running. Then i just loaded software to each PC & laptop and discover that new Network Printer and whalla....works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Doomkoft

customer_reviews.title: Works and doesn't waste my time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer after I got sick of my Dell v715w being 'unavailable' from my windows 7 and 8 computers. The printer would be connected to the wireless network, but not print. I have both printers connected. I tried to print to the dell a couple times and after that haven't even bothered. The Epson 845 has always been online and I don't end up spending 10 minutes to print 2 pages. Some of the additional features and interface are probably nicer on the dell, but I couldn't care less. I haven't compared color printing, most of what I do is work related B&W on minimum color.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Boughtthis

customer_reviews.title: Great photo copier.
customer_reviews.text: I have had it now for a number of years and it still works great. Photocopies can be of high quality or low quality Your choice.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Finally a dependable printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through several printers to get to this one. After reading the reviews on several sites I chose this model. After a few months of operating it hasn't left me down yet. I want a printer to work when I want it to and this one does just that. Nice display, plenty of options, but the paper trays are a little hard to use with envelopes or smaller than normal page printing projects. Otherwise I highly recommend this printer. I will know for sure after replacing the ink the first time if this is the actual machine for me but I'm hoping for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Take It Home27

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LOW BUDGET PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: This is my current printer after having an HP laserjet for many years. Functionalitywise it works well, scanner, printer, copy machine function. Print qualitywise I felt my HP did a better job at a lower setting. Print quality is still decent but you have to set the print setting to High Quality but then it slows the machine printing time down. Cheaper alternative to the HP printers and good if you're on a budget but if money is not a factor, get an HP.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. No problems setting it up. I use it at home. My three children and I each have our laptops set to print to it and we've had no problems. Prints come out nice quality, although we print most things on FAST DRAFT or FAST NORMAL. We are primarily using it as a printer, not a fax machine or scanner yet. It has a cool feature where you can e-mail to it. The feature was easy to set up and I saved the e-mail address in my phone but I haven't used that feature yet. I could see it coming in handy, though.
customer_reviews.author: Anne McAneny

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our office since the HP unit we had caused many problems. I noticed a few other offices in our area used the same one so I decided to give it a try since they all seemed to love theirs. I ordered it and when it arrived I hooked it up immediately and downloaded the drivers. This printer worked great and prints much faster than the hp 6500 we had. The fax part is great and it copies real well. I highly recommend this product for anyone looking to upgrade their printer or just want a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Lurker

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Got this instead of the current model as it came with the large ink tanks and the new model comes with the smaller ones. Much better than the HP it replaced as well as the Canon (see my review of that POS in my other reviews) that we relegated to the kitchen. Fast and software is not bloated like all too many printers (are you listening HP?). Faxes fine from either the PC or the panel. Don't know why some have reported it does not. Also works well via wireless and wired networks and with our mobile devices.
customer_reviews.author: Astroman

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this Epson Printer !
customer_reviews.text: This Epson WF 845 printer does everything it advertises for 2 Macbook Pro's running 10.6.8. My bride, who admits she's electronically challenged, has had no problems printing, scanning, faxing, or copying. We had an old Epson Stylus Scan 2000 and it's scan software went out of date, leaving us with just copy and printing until it started leaking. We didn't know what we were missing ! If you're thinking of this printer... you won't find one better. Start up with software and instructions was a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Rog

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer / Scanner
customer_reviews.text: So far i have owned a few printers of all makes. The last two were Canon. The last one I had which I have now given to my son was not user friendly & stopped working over Wifi. For weeks I debated which replacement to buy. Canon makes great products, but my previous experience worked against it. Epson is also a great printer and this particular model is working very nicely. Scanning wirelessly is a breeze & that was my primary objective b/c I scan-send instead of faxing. So far i am very happy with it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist585

customer_reviews.title: A terrific all-in-one printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 6 months, and am really happy with it. I work from home, and it's wonderful to be able to send print jobs wirelessly from any room with my laptop to the printer located in my den. The print quality is excellent, and the ink cartridges last a lot longer than previous ink-jet printers I've owned. I've used this printer A LOT, and it's held up very well so far (knock on wood). It's amazing to me that for less than $200, I have a printer, scanner, and copier. Thanks amazon and Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Linda SD

customer_reviews.title: GLAD I RECONSIDERED.....
customer_reviews.text: October 5, 2012: Returned the first 845 because of malfunctioning fax. Received second 845 and the fax works because I received a 16-page fax from a party that has mistakenly used my number before. There is just one number difference in the telephone/fax. Printing a duplex document (great duplex!!!) in the quiet mode now. Prints slower, but quieter. Set-up was easy, scanner drivers did not load on set-up, found where to download, everything else okay. Definitely recommend the 845 printer....
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing, it does everything we could ever ask from it. I honestly print more from my phone then i do my computer, only because it offers WiFi printing! Its so convenient! You can place this anywhere in the house near a wall outlet. The only times i've actually walked to the printer is to get the papers it printed or to change the ink. The ink lasts a long time and isn't too expensive to replace. I love epson quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kirby Coggin

customer_reviews.title: Expensive to operate.  Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: Ink costs are excessive. Image quality has dropped off. Drops wifi too often, though this could be my computer?
customer_reviews.author: Ed Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Printer terrific and customer service amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This printer could also be called a workhorse and not just workforce. It really is super easy and convenient to use for big and little jobs. And over the course of the year that I had it I called customer service 3 times and each time they were amazingly helpful and accommodating. Printers are generally a pain and the knee jerk reaction to a problem is to just buy another one, which is silly, wasteful, expensive and bad for the planet. With Epson you can stick with the original purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Never Loved an Office Appliance Before
customer_reviews.text: I never really had an opinion about whatever printer was setting on my desk, until now. I regret all the years I put up with my p.o.s. HP printer that used to jam, self-clean at the least convenient times, and guzzle ink. I just thought, 'that's what printers do.' I bought this based on Amazon reviews, and I'm so glad I did! So, I came back to write my own. It's been two-and-a-half years, and I still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Deziderata

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up with iPad and iMac
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers said, it was easy to set up this printer on wifi. It prints quickly and reasonably quietly. The iPad apps I am using do not let me select the printer tray, so I need plain paper in the top tray. The top tray is the only one that adjusts for snapshot sized paper. I don't often print snapshots, but for those who do, this might be a drawback. I have not set up the fax feature and have yet to scan, but I mostly print and it is doing well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new printer/scanner/copier when our dinosaur HP finally died. This printer does the job well, was easy to set up and so far I haven't had any issues. It is kind of loud though, and sort of rocks the desk when it's working. No big to me, but if this is something that may bother you, I thought it was worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is good and ink last a long time
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just over three years with light usage. Print quality is good and ink last a long time. However, apparently not very durable. Yellow print cartridge wont print after all the trouble shooting and wasting money on new cartridges. I hate HP and tried Epson. On to Brother next I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dover

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly (to me) the wireless worked 100% with my Mac and Linux boxes. Scanning requires a USB cable be connected from the printer to a computer. I used to buy the cheapest printer available, but I'm glad I purchased this printer because it's a _lot_ faster at printing and we haven't had a problem with it yet - except for running out of ink. The cost of ink is painful, but I believe no less painful than other printers. (sad face)
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase this printer based on the reviews that I read (and the fact that it was $99 with free shipping.) Other customers that have given this printer a positive review have said everything that can be said about it and I completely support their reviews hence I will not elaborate on the technical details. I am completely satisfied with the purchase and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Diplomat

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer i've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 or 4 $100 printers that constantly jam, won't scan or work wirelessly consistently and then constantly need ink replacements. Finally i broke down and spent the $200(or so) on this Epson and I am so glad i did, though the ink is a little more expensive than it is with a cheaper printer, i've only replaced it once since July and both my husband and i use this every day to run our small business. It works flawlessly, i cannot recommend highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: MELISSA WHITE

customer_reviews.title: Printer is great! Shipping is Sh*+!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping ELECTRONIC EQUIPMENT in nothing but the DISPLAY BOX is ridiculously cheap and careless. Obviously, Amazon is blissfully unaware of the infamous treatment of boxes by shipping companies. Minus the obvious abuse of the not-designed-for-shipping box, this printer installed easily, works well, comes with the necessary inks and looks great while doing its business. :-) Yay, Epson WorkForce 845!!!!!! Boo, Amazon Shipping/Cost-cutting Dept.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Fossil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home office printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 2 years now and it has not failed me. I work from home and it gets a lot of use. Wireless works great and I can even print off my smart phone. Good quality B&W and color printing and it's fast. Auto feeder works great....no paper jams since I had it. Holds tons of paper. Square shape fits nicely on top of the bookshelf. This Epson WorkForce 845 is a solid printer. Should be called the WorkHorse.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this printer/scanner
customer_reviews.text: My previous Epson flatbed scanner lasted a lot longer than any other printer I've ever owned. I made the mistake of replacing it with an HP, which had poor scanning quality and then stopped printing black. So I decided to upgrade to the Epson WorkForce 845 and could not be happier. It's easy to set up, has fantastic scanning quality, and prints great. It's actually faster and better than what we use at my office. In short, this is a great machine and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: AcornManTop Contributor: Travel Guides & Tips

customer_reviews.title: 5 Things I Like about this printer.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome. Here are the five things that makes it awesome: 1. It works! No bugs so far. 2. Easy to Set-up. 3. It uses much less toner than my previous HP printers. The cost of operating the unit is much less. The toner seems to last forever. 4. The scan to PC works great (wireless) . I have always had issues with this before. 5. Printing quality is great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bigger

customer_reviews.title: A real work horse
customer_reviews.text: This is our main printer for a house with 2 kids at school and to more part time kids in college. We print and scan all the time and have gone through two sets of inks already. I've been very happy with the printer overall. the setup was easy but I did have a hard time with the wifi setup. It worked but since it was near my hub I did a wired connection instead. Its been working none stop since then and I've not had any problems with it since.
customer_reviews.author: Michel L. Cote

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I print from wherever my phone takes me, love it! I had another wifi printer and could never get it to work with the wireless function. This is great. I can put it in our commercial kitchen and my husband can print orders to it from out diningroom. The only con is the quality is not as good when printed through the wifi so you have to increase the ouput quality. draft quality leaves you with a product that is nearly impossible to see.
customer_reviews.author: linda smith

customer_reviews.title: Just died after very light but consistent use. In ...
customer_reviews.text: Just died after very light but consistent use. In order to find this out have been on the phone w tech support as they directed me to do 3 head cleanings, which used up almost all my ink, $30 (in addition to cost of printer) down the drain. Will never buy epson again. They do NOT make products that are built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. No hitches. Print quality good. Bit noisy when printing; I can live with that. Not sure if the paper holder will hold up over time- it seems a bit flimsy. We'll see. 13 May 2014: Just checking in. Printer working perfectly. Uses very little ink to print jobs. Cost savings there! Happy with my purchase. It jammed a couple of times when scanning- probably due to the wrinkly paper and not a flaw with the printer. No more HP for me!
customer_reviews.author: Val H.

customer_reviews.title: It's running, but getting there was a very bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: The first two, that's right two machines they sent me didn't work, and that's in spite of many hours on the phone with Epson techs. (I spent an equivalent amount of time with the folks at a private tech service I subscribe to as well.) Finally, after more than a week of effort I have a machine that works. Assuming that you don't care about scanning documents to Word which it can't do. The Epson people were very nice to deal with but I didn't want to do so and the overall experience was poor.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Not good with photo paper!
customer_reviews.text: Figured on getting a printer for generic printing of photos using photo paper. This printer was leaving feeder track marks on the paper. It was only happening with letter sized photo paper. Epson support told me it was a hardware issue and best to return it. I'm sure this device is great, I just got a bad one. I went for the Expression Premium XP800, which turned out to be very good. No feeder lines on the printout!
customer_reviews.author: cdlrosa

customer_reviews.title: Delight To Setup
customer_reviews.text: I have only just received the unit and so reviewing from a perspective of printing/copying/scanning is too soon. Certainly the few items we have sent to the printer are very nice looking. I wanted to address the ease with which this printer installs. Good cookbook print directions and smart software make the installation a dream. I didn't have a spare USB or Ethernet cable so I installed in a completely wireless environment. No hitches. Up and running in a jiffy. A good beginning for my new printer.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Maven

customer_reviews.title: This has been a horrible printer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer based on the favorable reviews, but it has been a poor printer from day one. It can only print about three pages without the paper getting jammed. After a paper jam, I often have to turn the printer off and back on to get the screen to clear. And now, a little over a year after purchase, the front screen broke completely and the printer will not turn on at all. Finally, the customer service is non-existent. After calling three numbers, the only number they keep sending me to is one that simply hangs up. I will definitely steer clear of Epson in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tollini

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Epson Workforce 845 for two reasons: It is compatible with wireless printing on Apple devices; it is a 4 in 1 machine which is useful to us. Both of these needs are met very well. Wireless printing is a breeze. Fax, scan and copy work very well. Everyday printing tasks are done without a problem. My only disappointment is that the printer, which has two paper trays, will not print photographs on photo paper from one tray and print on paper from the other. Several communications with Epson support have not provided a solution. This is not a major problem but a minor inconvenience that should be an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Tierney

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great printer for us. We have been using it at home for general household printing for about 6 months. Haven't used any photo paper yet nor have I faxed with it. The copier works fine in either flatbed mode or through the doc feeder. Using Windows Vista Home Premium SP2 install went smooth and have had no operating issues. Had been using an old B&W laser for higher quality for about 8 years, and was very pleased with the printing first time out on this Epson. The newer inkjet easily equaled my old Samsung laser, and at almost the same speed! As usual, Amazon's price really sealed the deal along with free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic modern printer for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Using it with a Google/Samsung Chromebox with Cloudprint and it works great. Color/B&W scanning excellent also. Nice touchscreen and wireless support for my Apple iPADs and iPhones too. Can't believe how cheap this is but maybe they get you on the printer cartridges. Haven't had to replace the original set yet so we will see how well they do. Excellent buy...
customer_reviews.author: Gil Velez

customer_reviews.title: So far I really like this printer!
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use, just does what I want and I don't have to fuss with it very often. If I put in a 43 page, double sized document and two copies--it happens. I have only had one paper jam ever. I love the paper drawers and how much they hold. The wireless feature is wonderful! We can be anywhere in the house and just pop off a copy of something with out having to be right in front of it. It is the best printer I have ever had. As a homeschooler, I have had a lot of printers.
customer_reviews.author: MommaH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-in-one printer
customer_reviews.text: I have been an HP user for a long time, but the reliability and customer support just aren't the same, any more. I read the reviews and found this printer would be an excellent replacemet for my old HP unit. Other than a call to Epson Customer support (which was incredibly helpful) to help me hook up my printer to my home network to use the scanning function, it has worked perfectly. No problems or complaints. Would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: GFC

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent and obstinate printer
customer_reviews.text: Lots of confusing settings, error messages, constant cartridge warnings, jamming. I'll not advise buying this printer.
customer_reviews.author: ArtM

customer_reviews.title: Smooth fast printing
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for almost a year now - it's still going great. I've had a fair few printers over the years, from each of the major brands, and never been terribly happy with them. This one is the best yet. It prints quickly and smoothly, scans easily to PC or SD card, and can even be used as an AirPrinter with Apple devices - very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Be warned! If one color cartridge goes out, this entire printer quits
customer_reviews.text: Be warned! If one color cartridge goes out in this printer, this entire printer quits. You cannot just remove the color ink cartridges and print in black and white. How stupid is that! The printer otherwise is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Xenogeny Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is the best printer so far in terms of functionality
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer so far in terms of functionality, price, economy and quality. Used it for few years and do not remember a single jam! Toners last a long time. Refurbished toners are dirt cheap for it. It works well for windows and Linux platforms. It beats all laser printers i had. It is great for both home and small business use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ditch your HP
customer_reviews.text: I have been a life long HP printer user and have never had another brand. I have probably had 10 HP printers over the past 20 years. I finally got frustrated with the HP 2 hour install process, the 60 GB of crap add-on software, the ink cartridges running out every month and the 3 minutes of gyrations it seemed to need to "warm up" before printing. The wireless is flawless. The setup was quick and painless. It prints very quickly and the cartridges last a long time. My PC and iPad print without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Greatreader

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable Value
customer_reviews.text: I reluctantly came to the conclusion I needed to get rid of my HP-C7280. From the start a scanned pdf page was always about a half a meg each. Way too big for simple text files and HP never corrected. I purchased the Epson (my first) for under $150 and have enjoyed scanned documents at reasonable sizes again. The printing and scanning feed is easily twice as fast as my HP and the dual paper trays is great for as much as I print. Overall excellent value! I'm now a loyal Epson customer after owning several HP printers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: Setup took a bit longer than I had expected, however, this printer is awesome! Does everything I need and is exceptionally fast with excellent output. I love the two paper trays, something I've never had at home. Quiet operation, and the ink design is perfect (twice the amount of black, with separate color inks). Cost of using this printer will be much less than my previous Dell and HP printers.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Waiting to use the extra ink I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer with extra ink cartridges, expecting to use them. It has been over a year, and through all of the school projects, legal documents, coupons, and receipts, it is still going strong on the original cartridges. This printer really sips on the ink. Great for the price, and refills are rarely needed for normal use. Don't let the cost of refills bother you if you don't need to use them often.
customer_reviews.author: ScottDonna

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: I can now print from my smartphone! This means I don't have to duplicate tasks for me, our kids and our household. I am extremely happy to find a reasonably priced printer that helps to minimize my work. With its own email I can print from home, my car, or across the world. I am extremely happy with this purchase. Oh, and I'm Still using the original ink cartridges!
customer_reviews.author: MaggieJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: The printer is nice for the first year or so i.e. while it is under warranty, but suffers mechanical failures soonafter. Customer service basically told me it was no longer their problem and that I should pay out of pocket to get it repaired. At this point, the cost of repair is more costly than the actual device. I'm never going to buy an epson product again.
customer_reviews.author: Supr Silvr

customer_reviews.title: We use this in our small office and it eats ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our small office and it eats ink, and for some reason the Epson is very difficult to make print on both sides. The fax component stopped working several months ago and we can't make it work again.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Worst Gear Ever
customer_reviews.text: The worst piece of gear I have ever owned. Not just the worst printer, the worst gear ever. For example: will print PDF docs but not MS Word docs! Clunky software interface is just the beginning of the unpleasant experience of tolerating this "printer". Scan function is OK but auto document feeder always scans crooked. Too many additional problems to list.
customer_reviews.author: faust pier

customer_reviews.title: A fabulous printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was so easy to set up. After reading several reviews, I decided to give it a try. It has really nice color printing and the ink lasts a long time. I'm still not through the ink that came with it. I'm not an extremely heavy printer user, but even if I did print a lot more, I think it would still be a great printer to use. I love the fact that it's wireless. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Deb W.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement a refurb!!
customer_reviews.text: Initial setup was easy. All features functioned well. Three months out the fax ceased working. Support was responsive and a "new" printer was soon on its way. The replacement printer was obviously a refurb - no cables, no documentation, no plastic covering on scanner bed and control panel, loose scanner bed cover - while they put a credit card lein for the price of a new printer on our credit card pending receipt of the broken device. Added insult, the included black print cartridge was a single vs the double that came with my orginal printer which had to be left in the device for shipping. Does not leave me feeling warm and fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, recognized network immediately, touch screen is easy to use - do not need manual to decipher! Have the printer is another room from computer and it is great to have it print and not be sitting in the middle of our room. It is very large so it is nice to have it out of the way. I like the second cassette for paper - I use it for misprinted papers that I may need a printout of something but the paper doesn't need to be 'perfect'! Have setting at normal because the two lower setting - economy ones, were barely legible. Does Airprint also!
customer_reviews.author: LMc

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, terrific quality
customer_reviews.text: Great home office printer. The wireless connectivity is excellent, works with my iphone and ipad, and was fairly painless to get it working with my wi-fi network. Only complaint is I wish it accepted 11x17 paper (I print a lot of plot plans). It maxes out at 8.5" wide paper, but will work fine for normal sheets and legal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Funk

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: You know, this printer has just been a little bit of a headache since we purchased it. It seems like I am always having to reconnect it to our home network, half of our devices are not able to find it when we are trying to print, and there just always seems to be some sort of an issue to resolve. The print quality is really nice and when it is hooked up and working properly the functionality is great, but the connection issues are persistent. I would not buy this printer again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: After years of using laser printers, I was a bit skeptical going to an inkjet. However I must say how pleased I am with this little workhorse. Great printing, fast, the kids can print what they want from their laptops wirelessly which is great. Not quite used to buying ink so frequently as I was used to the laser and cartridges, but still a really nice, nice printer. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: The Texan

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Light and loud
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to a very quiet laser printer so this one shocked when I first tried to print. Loud but at least I know it's printing. Very easy to install and set up but you definitely need to follow the instructions and don't get ahead of yourself. The print quality is as good as my laser was...without the constant spooler issues! Haven't tried the copy or fax yet.
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: Works well and has good network capability.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this device for over a month now and have been happy with it. It can scan and print over a network which is exactly what I wanted. The print quality seems appropriate for the price and I haven't had any problems with it. Used to have an HP officejet, but it died. I bought this because the reviews seemed better than on the HP's. So far it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: Helper

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I own a in-home business and use this printer daily. The quality and speed are great and the ink lasted forever. The only problem I had was once we changed our password for our wireless internet in our home, I had a hard time trying to troubleshoot the wireless connection on the printer. The interface and menu options are hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kemmet

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and dependable great warranty and support
customer_reviews.text: This has a very good and dependable scanner Liked using it
customer_reviews.author: Jim jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Macbook
customer_reviews.text: Just got this printer and it has worked great! It prints fast and very easy to set up/use. I run OS X Lion and I have had no issues. It connected to my network instantly. Likewise, I am able to wirelessly scan to .pdf. The only issue during setup was that I had to manually type the printer's IP address; my mac was not able to find it (not a big deal). This printer is also connected to my mom's Macbook Air, my brother's Macbook running OS X Leopard. No problems thus far and it is a great printer for the price. I will update if any issues arise.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce 845 Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Copier, Scanner, Fax, iOS/Tablet/Smartphone/AirPrint Compatible (C11CB92201)
product_meta.description:
Performance is Everything. The World's Fastest two-sided all-in-one, the Workforce 845 delivers high-speed, automatic, two-sided printing, copying, scanning and faxing while providing high quality prints your business deserves. And it makes it easy to print multiple pages with a 500 sheet paper capacity. Save on ink with the included Extra High-capacity ink cartridges up to 40% less printing costs than color lasers, a savings that helps make business printing affordable. Easily share your all-in-one with multiple PCs with built-in wired and wireless networking. Or,use Epson Connect to print from popular mobile devices. Built to perform,this powerful product is the perfect partner to help keep your business running at full speed.Compatible Operating Systems: Windows: Windows 7, Vista, XP, XP x64, Mac: OS X 10.4.11, 10.5.8, 10.6.x, 10.7.x.One-Year Limited Warranty.Computer Interface: USB: Hi-Speed USB 2.0, Wireless: Wi-Fi (802.11 b/g/n), Wired: 100 BASE-TX/10BASE-T Epson Connect Email Print, AirPrint.PC-Free Paper Support: Plain (8.5" x 11", 8.5" x 14", A4), Photo (4" x 6", 5" x 7", 8" x 10", 16:9 wide, letter, A4),Automatic Document Feeder: 30 sheets (Automatic two-sided ADF), Paper Sizes: 3.5" x 5", 4" x 6", 5" x 7", 8" x 10", 8.5" x 11", A4, B5, A5, A6, half letter, executive, user definable (3.5" – 44" in length), Maximum Paper Size: 8.5" x 44" ,Borderless Sizes: 3.5" x 5", 4" x 6", 5" x 7", 8" x 10", 8.5" x 11", A4, 16:9 wide.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


WORKFORCE 845 ALL-IN-ONE
PRINT | COPY | SCAN | FAX | WI-FI
WHY BUY?
Enlarge PERFORMANCE IS EVERYTHING.
The World’s Fastest two-sided all-in-one, the WorkForce 845 delivers high-speed, automatic, two-sided printing, copying, scanning and faxing while providing high quality prints your business deserves. And, it makes it easy to print multiple pages with a 500-sheet paper capacity. Save on ink with the included Extra High-capacity ink cartridges — up to 40% less printing costs than color lasers, a savings that helps make business printing affordable. Easily share your all-in-one with multiple PCs with built-in wired and wireless networking. Or, use Epson Connect to print from popular mobile devices. Built to perform, this powerful product is the perfect partner to help keep your business running at full speed. 





WHAT THE PRESS IS SAYING:

"The WorkForce 845 is made for users in the small office and home office market due to its energy efficiency, price, and functionality." ~PrinterComparison.com, (January 17, 2012)





FUNCTIONS

Up to 40% lower printing cost than color laser 
500-sheet paper capacity with two trays 
Extra High-capacity ink cartridges — get about 2x more prints 
Epson Connect — instant wireless printing from popular mobile devices 
World’s Fastest automatic two-sided printing 


SPEED AND IMAGE QUALITY

World's Fastest two-sided print speeds
Save time without sacrificing quality 
Professional quality output
Vibrant color documents and laser sharp black text 
Epson Connect
Print from your smartphone, iPad, tablet and more 
Instant-dry, smudge and water resistant inks
Individual ink cartridges allow you to replace only the color you need 


AFFORDABILITY

Up to 40% lower printing costs
Get professional quality color at an affordable price 
Get 2x more prints
With available Extra High-capacity cartridges 
Large paper tray
Holds up to 500 sheets, for high-volume print needs 
Automatic two-sided printing/copying/scanning
Save up to 50% of your paper supply 


WHAT IS ISO PPM?
ISO ppm is based on the international standard for measuring print speed. Black and color print speeds are determined in default, single-side mode, in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Actual print times will vary based on system configuration, software, and page complexity.

See www.epson.com/printspeed for details, including complete ISO reports.




ADDITIONAL FEATURES
 * Print and share from anywhere — get instant wireless printing from iPads, tablets, smartphones and more; supports Email Print and Epson iPrint app, plus Apple AirPrint and Google Cloud Print
 * Fast two-sided documents — easily copy, scan or fax your two-sided original
 * Built-in wired and wireless networking — easily share your all-in-one with others; built-in Easy Epson Wireless makessetup, networking and printing fast and easy
 * 7.8" touch panel — lights up only the buttons you need; includes a 3.5" LCD
 * Quickly scan and archive with included OCR software — scan important documents and save them as JPEGs or PDFs
 * Sharp documents — laser quality black text delivers crisp, high quality proposals and brochures
 * PC-Fax — fax documents directly from your computer
 * Front USB port — insert a thumb drive and upload files directly to your PC
 * High-speed faxing in black and color — as fast as 3 sec per page; speed dial storage up to 60 numbers; fax memory up to 180 pages
 * Protect important documents — smudge, fade and water resistant prints; documents rival those from a laser printer
 * Save energy — uses up to 70% less power than laser printers
 * Product protection you can count on — one-year limited warranty; phone support, without charge, for the life of the product; plus, get free templates and "how to" tutorials
 * Packaging Specifications (W x D x H) — Dimensions: Printing 17.6" x 22.3" x 12.3", Storage 17.6" x 14.5" x 11.8" and Weight 22 lb.




WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * WorkForce 845 All-in-One
 * Instruction manual
 * CD-ROM with drivers
 * Free sample paper pack
 * Power cord
 * Telephone cord
 * DURABrite Ultra High-capacity Ink Cartridges:
 * Four 127-series: Black, Cyan, Magenta, Yellow

EPSON INK SUPPLIES
 * 127 DURABrite Ultra Black ink cartridge, Extra High-capacity (T127120)
 * 127 DURABrite Ultra Black ink cartridge (Dual Pack) Extra High-capacity (T127120-D2)
 * 127 DURABrite Ultra Cyan ink cartridge, Extra High-capacity (T127220)
 * 127 DURABrite Ultra Magenta ink cartridge Extra High-capacity (T127320)
 * 127 DURABrite Ultra Yellow ink cartridge, Extra High-capacity (T127420)
 * 127 DURABrite Ultra Color MultiPack, Extra High-capacity (T127520)

EPSON PAPER SUPPLIES
 * Premium Presentation Paper Matte 8.5 x 11 in, 50 sheets (S041257)
